summary_comment: Dr. Fouts is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for her dedication, genuine care for her students, and engaging teaching methods. Students appreciate her supportive approach, including accommodations for those struggling, and her ability to make complex material accessible and enjoyable. Her classes are praised for fostering a familial atmosphere and encouraging active participation, though some note the importance of consistent attendance to stay on track.

Ratings.comment: I had 2 classes with Dr. Fouts and she is one of the best professors I've ever had. She invests so much time into her students and is genuinely passionate about what she does. I was struggling mentally one semester and missed a lot of class and she took time to check on me and accommodate my needs. She's a great professor and a great person.

Madame Fouts is an amazing professor! So kind and caring towards her students. She genuinely wants to help you learn the languages she teaches. The class consists of written exams, oral speaking quizzes, daily homework, Conversations Unbound, a couple writing assignments, and lecture preps before class. Make sure to go to class to learn!

The best teacher!!! The class is smaller but everyone is included and treated like a family. Definitely will get out your comfort zone but in a great way. She always as the best attitude and is always bringing the energy. The class itself is super easy and a nice GPA booster, the language is all written and pronounced the same as english.

She is so sweet and caring. Very understanding and as long as you show up and put in effort in participating, you will definitely pass. Loves students who show they care and challenge themselves to speak the language.

This course was different than 1101-1103, as it was more so about gaining conversational fluency than expanding vocabulary or learning grammar. She catered the content to what the class wanted. We listened to music, watched films, and read children's books. Daily homework, in-class "reports," 2 oral exams, and a final paper. My favorite professor!!

Mwalimu is one of the nicest, strongest people I have had the pleasure of knowing. She's the type of teacher that you know just adores her job and genuinely cares for her students. The class itself is easy, but if you skip, you're likely to fall behind. She keeps her students engaged with frequent activities. Daily homework but it's always short.
Absolutely amazing, its hard not to love Mwalimu Fouts. She genuinely cares about everyone and their ability to learn Swahili. Makes it very easy and understandable to learn Swahili.

I struggle learning languages but Mwalimu explains things really well and gives very clear guidelines on what to know. Being introverted in class is definitely a downfall, but her activities really do help you learn, even if theyre uncomfortable.

Mwalimu is the most amazing woman I have met. She is so compassionate and you can tell she genuinely cares about her class and the students. This woman is a true angel and deserves the Presidential Medal of Honor. You learn a lot in her class, but she finds a way to make it interesting and relevant at the same time. It is a blessing to meet her.
Mwalimu is amazing, and if you tell her you need extra help she'll do anything to get you through. Be prepared to get out of your comfort zone, but she's by far the best Swahili professor.

Mwalimu Fouts is an amazing Swahili instructor - all three of the instructors at OSU are awesome actually.  It's pretty easy to get an A in this class. Attendance is helpful or you will get lost really quickly because she changes topics frequently.  There is homework almost every night but she only randomly checks it sometimes. Easy A for 4 credits

I went on the Global May Uganda program with Dr. Fouts and it was AMAZING. Do not think twice about going on this study abroad experience-- Dr. Fouts provides a rewarding and potentially life changing experience to all of the students who go on the trip. She is an amazing individual! Take the opportunity to learn from her if you can.

Mwalimu Fouts is by far the best professor I've ever had. She makes class so much fun, she's SO nice, and truly cares about all of her students and treats you as one of her own. She has a great sense of humor and you can't help but love being around her. She's a great teacher all around. I highly recommend her!

Mwalimu is the BEST professor I have ever had. She really cares for her students and wants everyone to succeed. If you need an easy A definitely take Swahili. She is genuinely one of the nicest people I have ever met. Her quizzes are easy as long as you listen in class. Homework is minimal. As long as you come to class, you'll pass. I love Mwalimu!

Mwaliumu Fouts is the best teacher I've ever had when learning a foreign language. She is so helpful and provides fun, different ways to learn Swahili. She is so passionate and loves doing what she does. She makes the best out of everything and I was thrilled going to class everyday.
The best professor you will ever take. If you want an easy A for 3 semesters and want to have fun doing it, take Mwalimu Fouts. She is the best.

She is easily the best prof I've had here.  I've taken several languages at OSU and struggled, but she made swahili enjoyable and easy to learn.  Go to class and do the short hw assignments and it will actually be easy to learn the material.

Mwalimu was extremely helpful & really cared about the class. I would suggest taking Swahili if you need a foreign language because there is no way I would get all A's in any other language. She was very clear and wanted every student to succeed. Work is not hard, just make sure you go to class. She's funny and helpful- Take this with Mwalimu Fouts
Mwalimu Fouts was always help and clear in her explanation of Swahili and it's rules, especially showing us how we as English speakers need to change how we think to communicate right.

Mwalimu Fouts is awesome. She is incredibly helpful, intelligent, and obviously cares about the students above anything else. The class is super easy, but also super informative. Plus, she doesn't take crap from the football players which is refreshing. A+ A+ A+!

The best teacher I have ever had! She likes to challenge each of her students personally but always makes sure that you understand the material:) If you really want to learn Swahili take her class. You wont only learn about Swahili though, you will learn about life as well!

The easiest teacher in the world. She gives extra credit all the time and makes learning Swahili fun and easy! I felt like I was in Kindergarten because of all of the singing and dancing we did :) A lot of hot football players were also in my classes. I took Swahili 101-104 with her and got all A's. EASY! EASY! EASY!
she is soooo nice and very helpful! take Swahili!!
A lot of fun! you'll enjoy her class!

Easy Easy Easy! She helps you with whatevery you don't understand will move dates of quizes and exams if the class decides they aren't ready and give enough extra credit for someone who would normaly get a B to get an A+ and you really do learn alot as well
Taker her she is AMAZING!
Great Teacher!!!!  She is so amazing.  Makes Swahili so easy to learn, uses music and videos.  Everyone should take her
Great techer!
I had 3 swahili teachers, she was the best. She cares, and will do her best for you.

I found this instructor to be very helpful, approachable,and available to the students for any additional help they may need. I highly recommend this professor for her creativity in class it helped with the retention of the material.
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for their exceptional teaching quality, consistently providing extensive support and assistance to students.

Ratings.comment: Great Professor. Always helping.
